creator: dev@tomcat.apache.org
text:
tomcat.sh doesn't accept -security option

# /usr/local/tomcat3.2.1/bin/startup.sh -security
Using classpath: /usr/local/tomcat3.2.1/lib/ant.jar:/usr/local/tomcat3.2.1/lib/jasper.jar:/usr/local/tomcat3.2.1/lib/jaxp.jar:/usr/local/tomcat3.2.1/lib/parser.jar:/usr/local/tomcat3.2.1/lib/servlet.jar:/usr/local/tomcat3.2.1/lib/test:/usr/local/tomcat3.2.1/lib/webserver.jar:/usr/local/jdk1.3/bin/../lib/tools.jar
Starting with a SecurityManager
# Usage: java org.apache.tomcat.startup.Tomcat {options}
  Options are:
    -config file (or -f file)  Use this file instead of server.xml
    -help (or help)            Show this usage report
    -home dir (or -h dir)      Use this directory as tomcat.home
    -stop                      Shut down currently running Tomcat
Please provide info about OS & Platform
creator: nacho@apache.org
shinya_ohira@geocities.co.jp
text:
All.
Because it is shell script.

In tomcat.sh, the argument "-security" is checked, but not shift'ed before 
executing jvm.
